arts.ttl: Tranmere Rovers 1 Colchester United 3 - match report as U's claim away victory
arts.sum: Things got even better for Colchester in the 33rd minute when Taylor had the simple task of side footing home his second of the game from a few yards after Payne had picked him out, following another good U's move. Boosted by the breakthrough, Colchester went in search of more goals after that and played some attractive football in the Tranmere half.

arts.ttl: Nigel Adkins under increasing pressure as Tranmere beaten by Colchester
arts.sum: A Lyle Taylor double and an Owura Edwards strike did the damage.

arts.ttl: Colchester United under-21s see off Preston North End in Premier League Cup
arts.sum: After half-time, Martin followed a team-mate trialist D into the referee"s book and Johnny Brindle fired the resulting free kick well over the bar. In a fairly low key first half, there was an early late challenge on Max Jolliffe which just resulted in a free-kick on five minutes.

arts.ttl: Tranmere Rovers v Colchester United - team news, odds, all you need to know
arts.sum: Colchester will once again be without Samson Tovide (hamstring) and Rob Hunt (calf) for today’s game while young midfielder Milton Oni remains a long-term absentee after suffering an ACL injury, in the opening weeks of the season. Colchester United head coach Danny Cowley on Tranmere Rovers game:

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace player eyed by Colchester United to join new club after Swindon Town trial
arts.sum: Recent Swindon Town trialist Jadan Raymond is set to join Queen’s Park on loan from Crystal Palace, as… The post Crystal Palace player eyed by Colchester United to join new club after Swindon Town trial appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: TRANSFER WINDOW: Colchester snap up West Ham defender Michael Forbes on loan
arts.sum: The Northern Ireland international had spent the first half of the season on loan from Bristol Rovers, before his spell at the League One side was cut short due to a hamstring injury. "He had a really good loan in the first half of the season at Bristol Rovers, which I think gave him a really feel and experience of what senior football looks like on a Saturday-Tuesday-Saturday basis and we're pleased to have him with us."

Tranmere continue to slide down the League Two table and head towards the dropzone. Their 3-1 defeat to Swindon in midweek made it nine defeats in their last 14 games. Colchester's 1-0 win over Morec...

arts.ttl: Colchester United youngsters see off Millwall in fine home victory
arts.sum: After a nice one-two, the Millwall left-back saw his shot saved by Jack Sexton while Elkanah Akor's high cross into the box saw the away keeper struggle to tip it around the post. Soon after that, Rash Drysdale saw his deflected shot saved and as the visitors broke well, the left winger got into the box but there was some superb covering back by Ronnie Harvey.
